page.title: 17RIVERS AND FISHING
page.content: Fishing is a popular pastime in the Llangadog area because many streams and rivers run through our "D" block. The River Towy is the largest river, and three of its tributaries,the Rivers Bran,Sawdde and Marlais flow into it in this area.The rivers are very clean and fishermen often catch salmon,sewin and trout.They also catch lampreys and eels.The Llangadog Angling Association owns some of the fishing rights in the area,but much of it is owned by Associations from far away.Since the Llyn Brianne Dam was built in the upper reaches of the Towy about ten years ago,fishermen have complained that there are not so many fish in the river.Wild life seen on and near the rivers recently include otters,swans and kingfishers.
